segment.source: How to Configure a Deployment Package
segment.target: How to Configure a Deployment Package

segment.source: How to Configure a Deployment Package
segment.target: How to Configure a Deployment Package

segment.source: How to Configure a Deployment Package
segment.target: How to Configure a Deployment Package

segment.source: The Packaging wizard walks you through the creation of a package by creating a folder on your local computer and transferring all the required installation files to the single folder.
segment.target: The Packaging wizard walks you through the creation of a package by creating a folder on your local computer and transferring all the required installation files to the single folder.

segment.source: The contents of the folder can then be moved to multiple removable media drives for distribution.
segment.target: The contents of the folder can then be moved to multiple removable media drives for distribution.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A single package cannot contain installation files for both x86 and x64 systems.
segment.target: A single package cannot contain installation files for both x86 and x64 systems.

segment.source: How to Create a Deployment Package
segment.target: How to Create a Deployment Package

segment.source: To create a deployment package
segment.target: To create a deployment package

segment.source: Verify in the Images module that you have created at least one local packed image.
segment.target: Verify in the Images module that you have created at least one local packed image.

segment.source: On the Tools menu, select Packaging wizard.
segment.target: On the Tools menu, select Packaging wizard.

segment.source: On the Packaging wizard welcome page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Packaging wizard welcome page, click Next.

segment.source: On the Workspace Image page, select the Include image in the package check box to include an image in the package.
segment.target: On the Workspace Image page, select the Include image in the package check box to include an image in the package.

segment.source: The Image field is enabled.
segment.target: The Image field is enabled.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: An image is not required in a MED-V package; the package can be created without an image.
segment.target: An image is not required in a MED-V package; the package can be created without an image.

segment.source: In such a case, the image should be uploaded to the server so that it can later be downloaded over the network to the client, or pushed to an image pre-stage folder.
segment.target: In such a case, the image should be uploaded to the server so that it can later be downloaded over the network to the client, or pushed to an image pre-stage folder.

segment.source: Click the Image list to view all available images.
segment.target: Click the Image list to view all available images.

segment.source: Select the image to be copied to the package.
segment.target: Select the image to be copied to the package.

segment.source: Click Refresh to refresh the list of available images.
segment.target: Click Refresh to refresh the list of available images.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the MED-V Installation Settings page, select the MED-V installation file by doing one of the following:
segment.target: On the MED-V Installation Settings page, select the MED-V installation file by doing one of the following:

segment.source: In the MED-V installation file field, type the full path to the directory where the installation file is located.
segment.target: In the MED-V installation file field, type the full path to the directory where the installation file is located.

segment.source: Click ... to browse to the directory where the installation file is located.
segment.target: Click ... to browse to the directory where the installation file is located.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This field is mandatory, and the wizard will not continue without a valid file name.
segment.target: This field is mandatory, and the wizard will not continue without a valid file name.

segment.source: In the Server address field, type the server name or IP address.
segment.target: In the Server address field, type the server name or IP address.

segment.source: In the Server port field, type the server port.
segment.target: In the Server port field, type the server port.

segment.source: Select the Server is accessed using https check box to require an https connection to connect to the server.
segment.target: Select the Server is accessed using https check box to require an https connection to connect to the server.

segment.source: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Do one of the following:

segment.source: Click Default installation settings, and then click Next to continue and leave the default settings.
segment.target: Click Default installation settings, and then click Next to continue and leave the default settings.

segment.source: Click Custom installation settings, and then click Next to customize the installation settings.
segment.target: Click Custom installation settings, and then click Next to customize the installation settings.

segment.source: On the MED-V Installation Custom Settings page, in the Installation folder field, type the path of the folder where the MED-V files will be installed on the host computer.
segment.target: On the MED-V Installation Custom Settings page, in the Installation folder field, type the path of the folder where the MED-V files will be installed on the host computer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It is recommended to use variables in the path rather than constants, which might vary from computer to computer.
segment.target: It is recommended to use variables in the path rather than constants, which might vary from computer to computer.

segment.source: For example, use %ProgramFiles%MED-V instead of c:MED-V.
segment.target: For example, use %ProgramFiles%MED-V instead of c:MED-V.

segment.source: In the Virtual machines images folder field, type the path of the folder where the virtual images files will be installed on the host computer.
segment.target: In the Virtual machines images folder field, type the path of the folder where the virtual images files will be installed on the host computer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are using image pre-staging, this is the image pre-stage folder where the image is located.
segment.target: If you are using image pre-staging, this is the image pre-stage folder where the image is located.

segment.source: In the Minimal required RAM field, enter the RAM required to install a MED-V package.
segment.target: In the Minimal required RAM field, enter the RAM required to install a MED-V package.

segment.source: If the user installing the MED-V package does not have the minimal required RAM, the installation will fail.
segment.target: If the user installing the MED-V package does not have the minimal required RAM, the installation will fail.

segment.source: Select the Install the MED-V management application check box to include the MED-V management console application in the installation.
segment.target: Select the Install the MED-V management application check box to include the MED-V management console application in the installation.

segment.source: Select the Create a shortcut to MED-V on the desktop check box to create a shortcut to MED-V on the host's desktop.
segment.target: Select the Create a shortcut to MED-V on the desktop check box to create a shortcut to MED-V on the host's desktop.

segment.source: Select the Start automatically on computer startup check box to start MED-V automatically on startup.
segment.target: Select the Start automatically on computer startup check box to start MED-V automatically on startup.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Additional Installations page, select the Include installation of virtualization software check box to include the Virtual PC installation in the package.
segment.target: On the Additional Installations page, select the Include installation of virtualization software check box to include the Virtual PC installation in the package.

segment.source: The Installation file field is enabled.
segment.target: The Installation file field is enabled.

segment.source: Type the full path of the virtualization software installation file, or click ... to browse to the directory.
segment.target: Type the full path of the virtualization software installation file, or click ... to browse to the directory.

segment.source: Select the Include installation of Virtual PC QFE check box to include Virtual PC update installation in the package.
segment.target: Select the Include installation of Virtual PC QFE check box to include Virtual PC update installation in the package.

segment.source: The Installation file field is enabled.
segment.target: The Installation file field is enabled.

segment.source: Type the full path of the Virtual PC update installation file, or click ... to browse to the directory.
segment.target: Type the full path of the Virtual PC update installation file, or click ... to browse to the directory.

segment.source: Select the Include installation of Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 check box to include the Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 installation in the package.
segment.target: Select the Include installation of Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 check box to include the Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 installation in the package.

segment.source: The Installation file field is enabled.
segment.target: The Installation file field is enabled.

segment.source: Type the full path of the Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 installation file, or click ... to browse to the directory.
segment.target: Type the full path of the Microsoft .NET Framework 2.0 installation file, or click ... to browse to the directory.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Finalize page, select the location where the package should be saved by doing one of the following:
segment.target: On the Finalize page, select the location where the package should be saved by doing one of the following:

segment.source: In the Package destination field, type the full path to the directory where the package should be saved.
segment.target: In the Package destination field, type the full path to the directory where the package should be saved.

segment.source: Click ... to browse to the directory where the installation files should be saved.
segment.target: Click ... to browse to the directory where the installation files should be saved.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Building the package might consume more space than the actual package size.
segment.target: Building the package might consume more space than the actual package size.

segment.source: It is therefore recommended to build the package on the hard drive.
segment.target: It is therefore recommended to build the package on the hard drive.

segment.source: After the package is created, it can then be copied to the USB.
segment.target: After the package is created, it can then be copied to the USB.

segment.source: In the Package name field, enter a name for the package.
segment.target: In the Package name field, enter a name for the package.

segment.source: Click Finish to create the package.
segment.target: Click Finish to create the package.

segment.source: The package is created.
segment.target: The package is created.

segment.source: This might take several minutes.
segment.target: This might take several minutes.

segment.source: After the package is created, a message appears notifying you that it has been completed successfully.
segment.target: After the package is created, a message appears notifying you that it has been completed successfully.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you saved all the files locally, and not directly on the removable media, ensure that you copy only the contents of the folder and not the folder itself to the removable media.
segment.target: If you saved all the files locally, and not directly on the removable media, ensure that you copy only the contents of the folder and not the folder itself to the removable media.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The removable media must be large enough so that the package contents consume a maximum of only three-quarters of the removable media's memory.
segment.target: The removable media must be large enough so that the package contents consume a maximum of only three-quarters of the removable media's memory.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When creating the package, up to double the size of the actual package size might be required when the build is complete.
segment.target: When creating the package, up to double the size of the actual package size might be required when the build is complete.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Creating a MED-V Image
